snippet: The mistake Patrick Reed, 23, made in saying he considers himself to be a top-five player on the PGA Tour seems to be not in believing he is one of the best but in merely blurting it out.
abstract: Karen Crouse On Golf column contends that Patrick Reed, and several other young golfers, lack the gentility usually associated with the sport; notes that brash newcomers are taking quite a few tournament victories of late.
lead_paragraph: The mistake Patrick Reed, 23, made in saying he considers himself to be a top-five player on the PGA Tour seems to be not in believing he is one of the best but in merely blurting it out.

headline.main: Boldly Upsetting the Field, and the Establishment
headline.print_headline: Boldly Upsetting the Field, and the Establishment
